meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a tramp.
meanings.sent1: The old, trampy man wandered the streets with a torn coat.
meanings.sent2: Her trampy outfit consisted of mismatched shoes and a dirty hat.
meanings.sent3: The trampy cat knocked over the trash cans looking for food.
meanings.sent4: The trampy alley was filled with discarded belongings and stray animals.
meanings.sent5: The trampy smell of the abandoned building lingered in the air.

meanings.sent1: The trampy room was cluttered with clothes strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children returned home with trampy hair and muddy shoes.
meanings.sent3: The trampy garden had overgrown weeds and tangled vines.
meanings.sent4: The trampy desk was covered in scattered papers and pens.
meanings.sent5: The trampy look of the house gave it a lived-in feel.

meanings.definition: Promiscuous or sexually provocative in behavior.
meanings.sent1: She received judgmental looks for her trampy attire at the party.
meanings.sent2: The trampy dancer captivated the audience with her sultry moves.
meanings.sent3: His trampy jokes made everyone blush and laugh at the same time.
meanings.sent4: The trampy character in the play added a touch of scandal to the story.
meanings.sent5: The trampy behavior of the guests shocked the conservative attendees.
